instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Hi, got an 820-3437, no visible signs of water damage.

Ive got green light but not fan spin.

PP3V42_G3H = 3.4v

PPBUS_G3H = 8.5v

PP5V_S5 = 5.0v

PP5V_S0 = 0v

PP3V3_S5 = 3.3v

PP3V3_S4 = 0v

PP3V3_SUS = 3.3v

PP3V3_S3 = 0v

PP1V8_S3 = 0v

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L, at same time.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Then may have a problem with SMC.
SMC_ONOFF_L is steady high?
Until trigger it, of course.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: yes,  SMC_ONOFF_L  is steady high at 3.4v

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Try reballing SMC, or change it.

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Replaced it, no change, is it possible its something else?  Ive got not more  820-3437´s for the time being to get another SCM Chip

threads.title: 820-3437 Green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
So PM_PWRBTN_L has always 3V?
Even at the moment you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
In such case, check all SMC (2 OF 2) voltages and signals, at page 37.
If o-scope available, check for 12MHz at Y5110.
